event.title: occupied the coast of Northeastern Brazil for several thousand years

data.event: Several indigenous tribes occupied the coast of Northeastern Brazil for several thousand years, and the hills of the present day municipality of Olinda had settlements of Caetés and Tupinambá tribes, which were frequently at war.
The settlement of Olinda was founded in 1535 by Duarte Coelho Pereira; it was elevated to a town on March 12, 1537.

event.title: was elevated to a town on March 12, 1537

data.event: The settlement of Olinda was founded in 1535 by Duarte Coelho Pereira; it was elevated to a town on March 12, 1537.

event.title: was made the seat of the Territorial Prelature of Pernambuco in 1614

data.event: It was made the seat of the Territorial Prelature of Pernambuco in 1614, becoming the Diocese of Olinda in 1676.
